instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <DIODE>D6910</DIODE> diod missing
threads.message: got this board , <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <DIODE>D6910</DIODE> diod missing , no green light..  can i use wire for this diod? i cant find the parts diod from any other board !!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <DIODE>D6910</DIODE> diod missing
threads.message: You can use <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> from an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> or <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in a pinch but you should have donor boards and no do not use a wire!
